ﻣﻤﻜﻦ أن ﺗﺆﺛﺮ اﻻﺿﻄﺮاﺑﺎت اﻟﻨﻔﺴﻴﺔ ﻋﲆ أي ﺷﺨﺺ ﰲ أي ﻣﺮﺣﻠﺔ ﻣﻦ ﻣﺮاﺣﻞ ﺣﻴﺎﺗﻪ. واﻟﺼﺤﺔ اﻟﻨﻔﺴﻴﺔ اﻟﺠﻴﺪة ﺗﻠﻌﺐ دوراً ﻣﻬﺎﻤً

اﻟﺼﺤﺔ اﻟﻨﻔﺴﻴﺔ وﻟﻜﻦ اﳌﻌﻠﻮﻣﺎت اﳌﺘﻌﻠﻘﺔ ﻤﺑﺼﺎدر ﺧﺪﻣﺎت اﻟﺼﺤﺔ اﻟﻨﻔﺴﻴﺔ ﻻ ﺗﺰال ﺿﺌﻴﻠﺔ. وﻟﺬﻟﻚ، ﺷﻌﺮﻧﺎ أن ﻫﻨﺎك ﴐورة 
ﻟﺘﻘﺪﻳﻢ دﻟﻴﻞ ﳌﻌﻈﻢ ﺧﺪﻣﺎت اﻟﺼﺤﺔ اﻟﻨﻔﺴﻴﺔ اﳌﺘﺎﺣﺔ ﰲ ﻣﺪﻳﻨﺔ اﻟﺮﻳﺎض. وﺷﻤﻞ ﺑﺤﺜﻨﺎ اﳌﺴﺘﺸﻔﻴﺎت واﻟﻌﻴﺎدات اﻟﺨﺎﺻﺔ،

ﺻﻌﻮﺑﺎت ﺗﺘﻌﻠﻖ ﺑﺎﻟﺼﺤﺔ اﻟﻨﻔﺴﻴﺔ، ﻛﺬﻟﻚ ﻣﺴﺎﻋﺪة اﳌﺨﺘﺼﻦﻴ ﰲ ﺗﻮﺟﻴﻪ ﻣﺮﺿﺎﻫﻢ إﱃ اﻟﺮﻋﺎﻳﺔ اﳌﻨﺎﺳﺒﺔ اﻟﻼزﻣﺔ.

Acknowledgements and Thanks | 2


Based upon the objectives of the National Committee for Mental Health Promotion (NCMH), which has 
been issued and approved by the Decree of the Saudi Council of Ministers, it is responsible for helping 
individuals with mental health disorders and their families to get access to treatment and rehabilitation 
services. In addition, the NCMH is also responsible for supporting mental health programs, correcting 
misconceptions about mental health, and coordinating between government and non-government 
organizations related to mental health. In line with the above objectives, the NCMH has supported this 
mental health directory. 
 
Your Guide: For Mental Health Services is available as an electronic copy on NCMH’s website, for more 
information please visit their website (www.ncmh.org.sa) or download their App (Qareebon – currently 
only available in Arabic) for more details about their services.
About the Directory
Mental health illness can effect anyone at any stage in their life and good mental health plays an 
important role in one’s quality of life. In our community the awareness in seeking mental health services 
has increased in the past few years however information regarding mental health resources are still 
scarce. Therefore, we felt that there was a necessity to make a directory book for the majority of mental 
health services available in the city of Riyadh. Our search includes hospitals, private clinics, associations, 
and rehabilitation and early intervention centers for all ages. This directory is aimed to help individuals 
and families dealing with any mental health related issues as well as help professionals guide their 
patients to the appropriate care needed.
If you are struggling or know of someone facing some difﬁculties in their life, 
please use this directory to help aid you in ﬁnding the right service and care.
About the Directory | 3
!


This directory contains four major sections which include 
Hospitals
If you believe that you are struggling or ﬁnding it difﬁcult to cope, you might ﬁnd the right care with a 
licensed mental health care provider in a hospital setting. This section contains both private and 
government entities starting with hospitals that provide care through an entire mental health division to 
other hospitals providing care through an individual mental health care provider within a hospital clinic. 
There are other general services included in hospitals that are provided for patients but are not necessarily 
limited to the mental health division, which include, for example speech therapy, occupational therapy, 
physiotherapy, transportation and home service. 
Private Clinics
If you believe that you are struggling or ﬁnding it difﬁcult to cope, you might ﬁnd the right care with a 
licensed mental health care provider in a private clinic. This section contains private clinics that provide 
care through both psychiatric and psychological services for children and adults.
Rehabilitation and Early Intervention Centers for All Ages
If you believe that your child or a relative’s child or a friend is suffering from any developmental delays or 
mental health disorders, please use this section to ﬁnd the right center. This section contains centers that 
provide a variety of services for special needs individuals (children and adults) that include mental health 
disorders, developmental disorders, intellectual disabilities, learning disabilities, and other related 
difﬁculties (such as speech, motor and physical disabilities). 
Associations and Committees
If you need support and awareness on your mental health disorder, please ﬁnd the appropriate association 
and/or committee related to your cause which can also help support the needs of your family. This section 
includes non-proﬁt organizations (private and governmental) that provide support, awareness, and/or 
training for individuals and their families dealing with any mental health disorders.
About the Directory | 4


How to use this directory
Every page contains a series of subsections about the facility which includes: general description, date of 
establishment, address, phone numbers, website, email, license number and licensing authority, services 
provided, transportation and home service, and social media sites. 
In the following, a brief description is listed of each service:
Description: a general description about the facility and what it offers; there may be differences from one 
facility to the other based on the information received. 
Date of Establishment: is when the facility was ﬁrst established.
License Number and Licensing Authority: each license number may differ in length from one facility to the 
other depending on the licensing authority except for government hospitals which were classiﬁed instead 
as “government entity” without listing a speciﬁc license number
Services Provided: the services listed in this section are the most common services provided by the 
majority of facilities. 
• Evaluation and Diagnosis: diagnosis can be made by either a Psychiatrist or Licensed Psychologist 
only. Evaluation can include the ﬁrst visit, mental health assessments and IQ testing. It is important to 
know that some of the centers do not have a Psychiatrist that can provide diagnosis however provide 
speciﬁc services like evaluation and behavioral therapy and other forms of therapy. 
• Psychiatrist: is a licensed medical doctor specializing in mental health providing diagnosis and 
prescription medication for mental health disorders while following up on the treatment plan for the 
client.
• Psychologist: is a licensed professional with an educational degree in the ﬁeld of psychology providing 
evaluation and non-pharmaceutical treatment (ex. behavior modiﬁcation, cognitive behavioral therapy, 
marital and family therapy, etc.)
 
• Speech Therapist: a service provided by a licensed professional in the diagnosis and treatment of 
communication disorders and speech and language difﬁculties.
How to use this directory | 5


• Occupational Therapy: a service provided by a licensed professional helping individuals suffering from 
physical, mental or cognitive difﬁculties to acquire and develop daily living skills.
• Physiotherapy: a service provided by a licensed professional who helps with developing abilities, 
rehabilitation, and adapting to any kind of injury or disability through movement and exercise. 
• Rehabilitation Services: any service that can help aid an individual to cope and to develop and obtain 
speciﬁc skills in life. For example, early intervention services, vocational services, rehabilitation for 
recovering substance users, etc. 
• Social Services: a service provided by a licensed social worker to help ease conditions of individuals 
living in tough circumstances by making sure that their daily living needs are met and providing ﬁnancial 
support and linking them to the appropriate resources. 
• Special Education: an educational service provided by a professional in the special education ﬁeld to 
identify difﬁculties and to develop the right academic program appropriate to their abilities.
• Other: this section includes any other service that is not listed in the previous mentioned services 
provided by the facility.
Practitioners in the ﬁeld of mental health are mandated to be licensed from the appropriate licensing authority (for 
example the Saudi Commission for Health Specialties, which provides licensing for health care practitioners and 
mental health practitioners). 
Saudi Commission for Health Specialties – Address: Diplomatic Quarter, Riyadh
Telephone: 920019393 – Website: www.scfhs.org.sa
How to use this directory | 6


Useful Tips:
• It is important to follow up with a qualiﬁed licensed professional within a licensed facility from the 
appropriate licensing authority. This means that it has to be licensed from the appropriate government 
authority (for example, ministry of health, ministry of labor and social development, ministry of education, 
etc.) and that each specialized professional is classiﬁed and licensed from the Saudi Commission for Health 
Specialties. 
• It is helpful to make a phone call to the facility before you go to get all the information needed for your 
care.
• It is your right to know about what treatment is provided (medication or therapy), the follow up plan 
and the cost of treatment.
• Knowing the needs of your child will help guide you to the appropriate center. 
• Find a center that is feasible for you to get to, in order to facilitate continuous follow ups according to 
your needs.
• Use the social media sites, website, email and contact information to help you get more information 
needed on the facility that is not included in the directory.
Disclaimer
We have made over best effort to ensure that the information in this directory is as accurate as possible 
and the sources used to obtain this information are believed to be reliable at the time the directory was 
printed. We aimed to ensure that every facility listed in the directory is licensed from the appropriate 
licensing authority. The services provided in this ﬁeld are constantly changing or being updated, therefore 
we urge any individual to check the information provided with the corresponding facility. We would like to 
bring to your attention that this directory is not for marketing purposes and is not sponsored by any 
facility. Its purpose is not to recommend a speciﬁc center but rather to provide information on the majority 
of mental health services in Riyadh. The National Committee for Mental Health Promotion and the 
individuals involved in this book are not legally responsible for any malpractice issues and consequences 
arising from any facility listed in this directory. Please take caution and responsibility when ﬁnding the right 
care provider.
If you are aware of any changes that should be made, or any licensed organization that has not 
been listed, please inform the National Committee for Mental Health Promotion.
Contact details are: info@ncmh.org.sa
Useful Tips | 7


If you are or know of someone struggling with any suicidal ideations or are in 
imminent danger, please go to the nearest emergency room. 
If you are experiencing any form of domestic violence or have a child at risk of any form of abuse, please 
call these services below:
The Child Help Line provides free phone consultations and support for 
children undergoing any form of abuse and neglect under the age of 18 
years to help ﬁnd them the appropriate care according to their needs. 
The Family Protection Hotline is for reporting Domestic Violence and 
Abuse while providing social protection for women of all ages, children 
under the age of 18, the elderly, and for individuals with special needs 
who are subjected to all types of domestic violence and abuse through 
a 24-hour hotline.
